author: nashatyrev
content:
Yep I believe this is the right interpretation. 
Though not quite sure why do we need such a big array size (1 week or whatever) while the original 'buffers' are just of 3 epochs size (current/previous/grandparent epochs)

author: .vbuterin
content: The reason I'm suggesting a big array is that if we want to have a `check_header_proof` opcode, then all the slots that headers need to be checked against would have to be in the state

author: .vbuterin
content: I guess the other option is sticking a Merkle proof into the proof

author: .vbuterin
content: But the problem there is that we don't want proofs to become invalid after one epoch
